intro: Satureja calamintha, commonly known as wild thyme or caraway thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, fragrant leaves that emit a minty aroma. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Satureja calamintha is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic and medicinal properties.
